com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence

Class SequenceListOnDisk<T extends SequenceDocument>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<T>
        • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.SequenceListOnDisk<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of sequence in the list
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SequenceListSummary.Provider, XMLSerializable, XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible, Iterable<T>, Collection<T>, List<T>

    public abstract class SequenceListOnDisk<T extends SequenceDocument>
extends AbstractList<T>
implements SequenceListSummary.Provider, XMLSerializable, XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
    A list of sequences which are loaded from disk on demand rather than all stored in memory. Caching is implemented so that recently requested sequences are not loaded from disk again. This class is immutable, except for caching. Sequences returned from AbstractList.get(int) may sometimes implement editable interfaces, but if they do, no attempt should be made to modify them. Any changes will be lost when the sequence is discarded from the cache.

    A SequenceListOnDisk can be constructed using a SequenceListOnDiskStandard.Builder or from an existing list using create(java.util.List, boolean, jebl.util.ProgressListener)

    If there is a problem loading a sequence from disk, the AbstractList.get(int) method may throw a RuntimeException whose cause is an IOException. However, in practice this shouldn't ever happen since we are reading from a local disk. However, if there is insufficient memory to load the sequence, it may throw a RuntimeException whose cause is an IOException whose cause is an OutOfMemoryError

    This class is thread safe

    Since:
    API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • toXML

        public org.jdom.Element toXML(String elementName)
        Converts this list to XML for use with storing in a PluginDocument. It can be reconstructed using fromXml(org.jdom.Element). Note that the implementation uses PluginDocument.FILE_DATA_ATTRIBUTE_NAME so the XML should only be used inside a PluginDocument
        Parameters:
        elementName - the name of the element to return
        Returns:
        this list serialized to XML

      • fromXML

        public void fromXML(org.jdom.Element element)
             throws XMLSerializationException
        Description copied from interface: XMLSerializable
        Restore the object from the JDOM Element returned by XMLSerializable.toXML().

        This method generally should not be called directly. Instead, you should usually call XMLSerializer.classFromXML(org.jdom.Element) or XMLSerializer.classFromXML(org.jdom.Element, Class) which calls this method internally.

        It is optional to implement this method. Instead of implementing an empty constructor and implementing this method properly, the implementation may instead throw an UnsupportedOperationException and implement a constructor that takes a single Element as a parameter. This allows for cleaner code such as support for final fields in the XMLSerializable class.

        The element parameter should not be modified since it may be reused. If you need a modified version of it, take a copy with Element.clone().

        Specified by:
        fromXML in interface XMLSerializable
        Parameters:
        element - representation from a previous call to XMLSerializable.toXML()
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the Element can't be converted into this type of object

      • create

        public static <T extends SequenceDocument> SequenceListOnDisk<T> create(List<T> sequences,
                                                        boolean tryCompressingSequences,
                                                        ProgressListener progressListener)
                                                             throws DocumentOperationException
        Creates a new SequenceListOnDisk from an existing list of ungapped sequences. For big sequence lists that can't be held in memory or for creating alignments, using a SequenceListOnDisk.Builder is recommended.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of sequence
        Parameters:
        sequences - the sequences to put in the list.
        tryCompressingSequences - true to try compressing the sequences into a more compact storage format. This will be slow, but result in sequences using less space on disk and later when loaded into memory.
        progressListener - for reporting progress and cancelling
        Returns:
        a new sequence list on disk or if the input was already a SequenceListOnDisk, returns that list.
        Throws:
        DocumentOperationException - if there is a problem reading/writing to disk.

      • createInterlaced

        public static <T extends SequenceDocument> SequenceListOnDisk<T> createInterlaced(SequenceListOnDisk<T> sequences1,
                                                                  SequenceListOnDisk<T> sequences2,
                                                                  ProgressListener progressListener)
                                                                       throws DocumentOperationException
        Creates a new SequenceListOnDisk by interlacing a pair of existing SequenceListOnDisks. Creation of an interlaced list is very fast. Since SequenceListOnDisks are immutable, the returned list can be backed by the same data hence no data duplication or scanning is required.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of sequence
        Parameters:
        sequences1 - the first sequences to put in the list.
        sequences2 - the second sequences to put in the list.
        progressListener - for reporting progress and cancelling
        Returns:
        a new sequence list on disk.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the 2 lists to be interlaced are not the same size
        DocumentOperationException - if there is a problem reading/writing to disk

      • getMaximumSequencesCached

        public static int getMaximumSequencesCached(boolean isAlignmentOrContig)
        Returns the maximum number of sequences (of length up to if unaligned which will be cached in memory at one time. A viewer on this data should not try viewing data when more than sequences are visible or it will hit cache throttling performance issues.
        Parameters:
        isAlignmentOrContig - true to get the cache size for alignments/contigs. False to get the cache size for sequence lists
        Returns:
        the maximum number of sequences which will be cached in memory at one time. A viewer on this data should not try viewing data when more than sequences are visible or it will hit cache throttling performance issues.
        Since:
        API 4.41 (Geneious 5.4.1)
        See Also:
        getMaximumCachedUnalignedSequenceLength()

      • getMaximumCachedUnalignedSequenceLength

        public static int getMaximumCachedUnalignedSequenceLength()
        Returns the maximum length of an unaligned sequence which will be cached in memory to improve performance. Up to getMaximumSequencesCached(boolean) sequences of this length or less will be cached to improve performance.
        Returns:
        the maximum length of an unaligned sequence which will be cached in memory to improve performance
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)
        See Also:
        getMaximumSequencesCached(boolean)

      • cacheSequencesInMemory

        public abstract void cacheSequencesInMemory(ProgressListener progressListener)
                                     throws DocumentOperationException
        Loads all sequences in this list into memory so that they can be quickly retrieved later using AbstractList.get(int)
        Parameters:
        progressListener - for reporting progress and cancelling
        Throws:
        DocumentOperationException - if the sequences cannot be loaded

      • invokeWhileHoldingLock

        public void invokeWhileHoldingLock(Runnable runnable)
        Invokes a runnable while holding the synchronization lock for this sequence list on disk. Normally each call to AbstractList.get(int) needs to wait on a synchronization lock and if multiple threads are doing this simultaneously, things can get quite slow. By obtaining the lock prior to a series of AbstractList.get(int) calls performance can be significantly improved. This is intended for use with rendering in the swing thread while other threads are calculating stuff in less important background threads.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable to run while holding the synchronization lock
